intro: Pterostylis splendens, commonly known as the splendid hooded orchid, is an epiphytic orchid native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its striking, hood-like flower that is typically white or pale yellow with a dark central stripe. The plant has a short, slender stem with a single, fleshy, oval-shaped leaf. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, often in clusters of 2–5. The orchid thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or branches in rainforest areas.
